ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the Blazing Fire will be displayed for all who can see.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And Hell made visible to him who can see,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and Hell will be brought in sight for anyone to see:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Hell fire will become visible for those who would see it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And hell will be made visible to all those who can see.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And Hell shall be made apparent for whoever sees.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the hell shall be made manifest to him who sees
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and Hell is advanced for whoever sees,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and Hell is there for all to see,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the Scorch will be made apparent to any one who beholdeth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and hell is brought into view for those who can see—
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And Hell-Fire shall be placed in full view for (all) to see,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And Hell-fire shall be made apparent in full view for (every) one who sees,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and when Hell is advanced for whoever sees,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And Hell will be displayed to whoever sees.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:36] and the Hell-fire, the consuming Fire, is revealed for all to see, for every on-looker (the response to idhā, ‘when’, is [what follows]):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth) to him who is ordained to enter it,
